title: Groups
content:
If you are an administrator, part of your responsibilities includes creating and managing user groups. Groups are useful for making assignments, identifying Level 1, Level 2, or Level 3 support groups, or assignment groups.

After you create a new user, you can add the user to one or more assignment groups. Role assignments can be automatic if you assign one or more roles directly to the group and then add a user to that group. The user inherits those group role assignments.

Note: For information on DND groups and how to configure DND authorization, see Configure authorization for Design and Deploy. 

How to create a group

You can create new groups, such as Service Desk or assignment groups.

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Groups.
  1. Click New.
  2. Type a group Name. This field is mandatory.

  3. Enter the User principal name for the group. This field is mandatory and must be unique.

     You can't include special characters in this field, including space and these characters: @;:=&<>#{}|`^~%'?\"/[].

  4. Select a Group type from the list of available types:

    Group type Description
    Organizational

    Group members belong to the same organizational unit within a company.

    Example: Marketing; R&D

    A person can't be a member of more than one organizational group.
    Functional

    Group members provide a similar function or service.

    Example: Help Desk; Human Resources
  5. (Optional) Enter an Email address for the group.

  6. (Optional) Select an Owner. Open the drop-down search window and search for the required person.

    When you add a person as the Group owner, then the person is automatically added as a group member.

  7. Click Save. The new group appears in the Groups list.

How to edit a group

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Groups.

  1. Select the group you want to edit.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

  2. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  3. By default, the group record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view.

    Tab Description
    General Displays general information about the current group. For more information, see the Group details section.
    Related groups

    Displays the groups related to the current group. For more information, see the Group details section.

    Available for functional groups only.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the current record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.

  4. Click   Save on the toolbar.

You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

Group details

General tab

In the General tab, the following sections are available:

General

Field Description
Name The name of the group.
User principal name

The UPN of the group.

This field is read-only.
Group type

The group type. These options are available: Organizational and Functional.

In organization groups, group members belong to the same organizational unit within a company. Example: Marketing; R&D. Note that a person can't be a member of more than one organizational group.

In functional groups, group members provide a similar function or service. Example: Help Desk; Human Resources

This field is read-only.
Group status

The group status. Select Active or Inactive from the drop-down list.

  • Inactive groups don't appear in the drop-down list of groups for the Owning group field in Change and Problem records.
  • New groups are defined as Active by default.
Email The email address of the group.
Language The language of the group.
Owner

The owner of the group. Note that you can select only a user, not a contact, as the group owner.

The behavior of the Owner field differs, depending on whether you manage group members in IdM (the Pull members from IdM switch ON) or Service Management (the Pull members from IdM switch OFF).

If you manage group members in IdM:

  • If you select a person who isn't a member of the group as the owner, Service Management throws an error when you save the record.

    To assign a user who isn't a member of the group as the owner, you must first assign the user to the group in IdM, wait for the scheduled job that pulls group members from IdM to run, and then assign the owner.

  • If the owner's user record is removed from the group in IdM, the Owner field will be cleared.

If you manage group members in Service Management and you select a person who isn't a member of the group as the owner, Service Management automatically adds the person to the group's members list.
Group owner backup

The backup owner of the group. Note that you can select only a user, not a contact, as the group backup owner.

The behavior of the Group backup owner field differs, depending on whether you manage group members in IdM (the Pull members from IdM switch ON) or Service Management (the Pull members from IdM switch OFF).

If you manage group members in IdM:

  • If you select a person who isn't a member of the group as the backup owner, Service Management throws an error when you save the record.

    To assign a user who isn't a member of the group as the backup owner, you must first assign the user to the group in IdM, wait for the scheduled job that pulls group members from IdM to run, and then assign the backup owner.

  • If the backup owner's user record is removed from the group in IdM, the Group owner backup field will be cleared.

If you manage group members in Service Management and you select a person who isn't a member of the group as the owner, Service Management automatically adds the person to the group's members list.
Area of practice The group's area of practice on the system. Select a value from the drop-down list.
External system Select an external system from the drop-down list if you want to make this group an external group. For more information about external systems, see External systems.
Assignment strategy Displays only when On-Call Schedule Management is enabled. For more information, see How to set up assignment strategy.

Pull members from IdM

If the group member sync feature is enabled at the tenant level, select this checkbox to make Service Management pull group members for this group from IdM at regular intervals.

You can select this checkbox only if the group has some roles assigned.

Selecting this checkbox means that you want to manage the group's members in IdM, and you can no longer manage (add or remove) the group's members in the group details.

If you select this checkbox for a group that already has members assigned from Service Management, the assigned members might be overridden by members pulled from IdM.

After you select this checkbox, you can't clear it unless the group members list from IdM is empty. If later you change your mind and want to manage members for this group from Service Management instead of IdM, you need to go to IdM to remove all members (and group rules) from the group, wait for the scheduled job that pulls group members from IdM to run, and then clear the checkbox.

Organizational information

Field Description
Ownership

The ownership of the group. The available options are Internal and Supplier.
Cost center The Cost center to which the group belongs.
Company

The supplier company denoted by the ownership. Appears only when Supplier is selected as the ownership.

Select a value from the drop-down list.

Group Members

To add a group member, do one of the following:

  • Click Add, then select a person to add as a group member.
  • Click the list icon (   ) to display the available people. Select the check box for each person that you want to add as a group member. Click OK.

To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

The selected people appear in yellow. When you save the group, the group members are added.

To remove a group member, select the member and click Remove. The selected members appear in strikethrough text. When you save the group, the members are removed.

By default, a group member's ID, name, and email are displayed. To customize the view, click Columns, select the item to be displayed, and click Add.

  • The added group members automatically inherit the role and domain assignments associated with the group.
  •  It is recommended to have the user member of only a few hundred groups (not more than 500 user groups) to ensure optimal performance for data retrieval when RLAC is enabled with the access filter referenced to a group, OR applying filters with My Groups or My Group View to view the records assigned to the groups the currently logged-in user is a member of.

Availability

Field Description
Work schedule Select a work schedule for the group.
Time zone Select a time zone for the group.

The work schedule and time zone may be used in SLT calculation if configured as such. For more information, see SLT settings.

System use definitions

Field Description
Group roles

The roles assigned to the group, if any. Click in the box to display a list of available roles. Select the required roles to assign to the group.

A group can have more than one role.

Encryption

Field Description
Encryption domains

The encryption domains to which the group belongs. For more information on encryption domains, see Encryption domains.

Related groups tab

In the Related groups tab, the following section is available:

The Related groups tab is only available for functional groups.

Commonly assigned groups

You can save a list of the groups to which you often reassign tickets.

To add or remove related groups, do one of the following:

  • Click Add, then select a group to add as a related group.
  • Click the list icon (   ) to display the available groups. Select the check box for each group that you want to add. Click OK.

To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button. For more information, see Filters.

The selected related groups appear in yellow. When you save the current group, the related groups are added.

To remove a related group, select the group and click Remove. The selected groups appear in strikethrough text. When you save the current group, the selected related groups are removed.

By default, a group's ID and name are displayed. To customize the view, click Columns, select the item to be displayed, and click Add.
